resources.string: There are a few important things to understand to get the most out of your phone.
Press "Begin" to start the tutorial and find out more.
Touch any text field to open the keyboard and start typing. When done typing, press your phone's "back" key to close the keyboard. Try it here!
Learn how to use the onscreen keyboard by playing a video.
An error occurs while playing video, please check the video file
To allow quick usage of the services offered by your %s, tap on the service icons below to set-up your accounts.
No more google account can be registered, your current account is:
No more Exchange account can be registered, your current account is:

Community has not been configured, it will be automatically launched after the tutorial.
Still continue to next step now?

Data service switch provides a way to enable and disable the data traffic, all the network connectivity services will be affected by this setting, such as Synchronization, Internet service, sending and receiving MMS, Email and so on.
You can disable data sevice at any time by turning off Data Service in mobile network settings.
Google's location service provides applications with your approximate location without using GPS.
You can disable collection at any time by turning off "Use wireless networks" in Settings.
Allow Google's location service to collect anonymous and aggregate location data. Collection will occur regardless of whether any applications are active.
Your Google account is now linked to this phone

Google applicaitons are syncing data now.
When the "syncing" icon %i disappears from the status bar at the top of your screen, the download has finished.

The configuration of this mobile phone will be adapted according to the Internet tariff you have contracted.
Do you have an Internet flat tariff rate?
When data service is enabled, you can use NetManager to enable or disable all the network connectivity applications.
Data transmission charges may apply. An unlimited data plan is recommended.
Would you like to learn more of your T10?
